pullRequest.title: Small fixes to samples from testing
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
The following (very) small changes have been made as picked up in a previous round of regression testing when the samples were all tested through:


Project Sample: removed a duplicate from the metadata file, was causing 2 duplicate code examples to display in SV / developer site.


Generate offline map with local basemap sample: added copyrights to all relevant files


Show callout sample: removed the animation 'duration' functionality from the callout. No other SDKs have this functionality so after discussing with the team it was agreed it was not needed as the sample is about displaying a callout where clicked. However this originally came up because on clicking around the screen rapidly with a duration set, the callout would gradually fade out and no longer be visible. Should this be raised as a Java bug anyway?


Ref: CS 2165
@JonLavi first, thanks :)

Checklist:

 Set target branch to master (current release) or dev (next release)
 Request a reviewer
 Assign a reviewer
 Tag reviewer in comment

commit.message: project sample remove duplicate in metadata file
generate offline map with local basemap add copyright

nodes.bodyText: @jenmerritt I think we should definitely raise an issue for the callout animation. Not sure how to describe it, but it's almost as if the animation duration is 'stacking' if we initiate another animation before it's finished. Feel free to log an issue (ideally add a snippet of the sample code and a gif), or give me a shout if there's anything to clarify.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ Click anywhere on the map. A callout showing the WGS84 coordinates for the click
 3. Get the screen point's location on the map using `MapView.screenToLocation(Point2D)`.
 4. Get the `MapView`'s callout.
 5. Set the title and detail of the callout to display the map point's coordinates.
-6. Display the callout at the map point and specify an animation duration by using `callout.showCalloutAt(mapPoint, duration)`.
+6. Display the callout at the map point `callout.showCalloutAt(mapPoint)`.
